metadata.title: CVE-2023-32248 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ksmbd, a high-performance in-kernelSMB server. The specific flaw exists within the handling ofSMB2_TREE_CONNECT and SMB2_QUERY_INFO commands. The issue results from thelack of proper validation of a pointer prior to accessing it. An attackercan leverage this vulnerability to create a denial-of-service condition onthe system.

criterions.comment: linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
